pageContext.description: Fragment of copper alloy spearhead, socketed mid-section of blade, irregular break at both ends, upper and lower parts missing. It belongs to the Wilburton Phase, so relatively early in the Late Bronze Age, c.1000 - c.900 BC. Extant length 70mm. Extant width 48mm. Thickness 16.5mm. Weight 63.24g.
pageContext.notes: In 2019 a group of middle to late Bronze Age metalwork was found in the same area and reported under the Treasure Act 1996, Designation Order 2002 (NMS-B2247B, 2019T945). Although it is likely that this spearhead was part of the same hoard, it cannot  retrospectively qualify as Treasure under the order.
